activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm
Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P. Heidenreich

records.addlTxt: No contact with victims (parents) or their address/No intoxicants/No taverns or any establishment that serves alcohol/Not to possess any firearm or contact with anyone who has firearms in their possession/The defendant is required to be monitored by the drug and alcohol monitoring through ADL Monitoring Solutions BEFORE release. The defendant is ordered to contact ADL at 920-283-1038 to make arrangements. The defendant is responsible for any costs associated with the SCRAM bracelet.

1:20 PM Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant states has PD in other cases. Sowinski statement to bail - will file for bond forfeiture in other cases. Defendant statement to bond. Court questions Defendant on bonds posted in other cases. Court sets bond. adj. 01:31 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
